Effect.Name: Skill Proficiencies
Effect.Description: Choose a skill proficiency from the list
Effect.ShortDescription: Choose a skill proficiency

Choice.Name: Animal Handling
Choice.ShortDescription: Gain proficiency with the animal handling skill

Choice.Name: Athletics
Choice.ShortDescription: Gain proficiency with the Athletics skill

Choice.Name: Intimidation
Choice.ShortDescription: Gain proficiency with the Intimidation skill

Choice.Name: Nature
Choice.ShortDescription: Gain proficiency with the Nature skill

Choice.Name: Perception
Choice.ShortDescription: Gain proficiency with the Perception skill

Choice.Name: Suvival
Choice.ShortDescription: Gain proficiency with the survival skill

Effect.Name: Rage
Effect.Description:
In battle, you fight with primal ferocity. On your turn, you can enter a rage as a bonus action. While raging, you gain the following benefits if you aren’t wearing heavy armor: • You have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
• When you make a melee weapon attack using Strength, you gain a bonus to the damage roll that increases as you gain levels as a barbarian, as shown in the Rage Damage column of the Barbarian table.
• You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
If you are able to cast spells, you can’t cast them or concentrate on them while raging.
Your rage lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are knocked unconscious or if your turn ends and you haven’t attacked a hostile creature since your last turn or taken damage since then. You can also end your rage on your turn as a bonus action.
Once you have raged the number of times shown for your barbarian level in the Rages column of the Barbarian table, you must finish a long rest before you can rage again.
Effect.ShortDescription: Gain advantage on strength checks, saves, and melee attack rolls as well as a damage resistance to nonmagical damage.

Effect.Name: Unarmored Defense
Effect.Description: While you are not wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.
Effect.ShortDescription: Gain CON to AC

Effect.Name: Reckless Attack
Effect.Description: Starting at 2nd level, you can throw aside all concern for defense to attack with fierce desperation. When you make your first attack on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly. Doing so gives you advantage on melee weapon attack rolls using Strength during this turn, but attack rolls against you have advantage until your next turn.
Effect.ShortDescription: Gain advantage on attacks while granting it against you.

Effect.Name: DangerSense
Effect.Description: At 2nd level, you gain an uncanny sense o f when things nearby aren’t as they should be, giving you an edge when you dodge away from danger. You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects that you can see, such as traps and spells. To gain this benefit, you can’t be blinded, deafened, or incapacitated.
Effect.ShortDescription: Gain Advantage on Dex saves vs. visble things

Effect.Name: Primal Path
Effect.Description: At 3rd level, you choose a path that shapes the nature of your rage. Choose the Path of the Berserker or the Path of the Totem Warrior, both detailed at the end of the class description. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th levels.
Effect.ShortDescription: Choose a path reflecting the nature of your rage.

Effect.Name: Skill Proficiencies
Effect.Description: Choose a skill proficiency from the list
Effect.ShortDescription: Choose a skill proficiency

Choice.Name: Arcana
Choice.ShortDescription: Gain proficiency with the Arcana skill

Choice.Name: Deception
Choice.ShortDescription: Gain proficiency with the Deception skill

Choice.Name: Insight
Choice.ShortDescription: Gain proficiency with the Insight skill

Choice.Name: Intimidation
Choice.ShortDescription: Gain proficiency with the Intimidation skill

Choice.Name: Persuasion
Choice.ShortDescription: Gain proficiency with the Persuasion skill

Choice.Name: Religion
Choice.ShortDescription: Gain proficiency with the Religion skill

Effect.Name: Sorcerous Origin
Effect.Description: Choose a sorcerous origin, which describes the source o f your innate magical power: Draconic Bloodline or Wild Magic, both detailed at the end o f the class description. Your choice grants you features when you choose it at 1st level and again at 6th, 14th, and 18th level.
Effect.ShortDescription: Choose the origin of your sorcerous power.

Effect.Name: Sorcery Points
Effect.Description: At 2nd level, you tap into a deep wellspring o f magic within yourself. This w ellspring is represented by sorcery points, which allow you to create a variety o f magical effects.
Effect.ShortDescription: Gain sorcery a pool of sorcery points

Effect.Name: Flexible Casting
Effect.Description: You can transform unexpended sorcery points into one spell slot as a bonus action on your turn. The Creating Spell Slots table shows the cost of creating a spell slot of a given level. You can create spell slots no higher in level than 5th. Level one slots cost 2 sorcery points, level 2 cost 3, level 3 cost 5, level 4 cost 6 and level 5 cost 7. You can spend spells as a bonus action to regain a number of sorcery points equal to the spell level.
Effect.ShortDescription: Spend socrecy points to regain spell slots, or spells to regain points.

Effect.Name: Skill Proficiencies
Effect.Description: Choose a skill proficiency from the list
Effect.ShortDescription: Choose a skill proficiency

Choice.Name: Arcana
Choice.ShortDescription: Gain proficiency with the Arcana skill

Choice.Name: History
Choice.ShortDescription: Gain proficiency with the History skill

Choice.Name: Insight
Choice.ShortDescription: Gain proficiency with the Insight skill

Choice.Name: Investigation
Choice.ShortDescription: Gain proficiency with the Investigation skill

Choice.Name: Medicine
Choice.ShortDescription: Gain proficiency with the Medicine skill

Choice.Name: Religion
Choice.ShortDescription: Gain proficiency with the Religion skill

ClassCustomization.Name: Path of the Berserker
ClassCustomization.Description: For some barbarians, rage is a means to an end--that end being violence. The Path of the Berserker is a path of untrammeled fury, slick with blood. As you enter the berserker’s rage, you thrill in the chaos of battle, heedless of your own health or well-being.
ClassCustomization.ShortDescription: Damage focused path, fully offensive rage powers.

Effect.Name: Frenzy
Effect.Description: Starting when you choose this path at 3rd level, you can go into a frenzy when you rage. If you do so, for the duration of your rage you can make a single melee weapon attack as a bonus action on each of your turns after this one. When your rage ends, you suffer one level of exhaustion (as described in appendix A).
Effect.ShortDescription: Gain an extra weapon attack as a bonus action each round.

Effect.Name: Mindless Rage
Effect.Description: Beginning at 6th level, you can’t be charmed or frightened while raging. If you are charmed or frightened when you enter your rage, the effect is suspended for the duration of the rage.
Effect.ShortDescription: Supress charm and fear effects while in rage.

Effect.Name: Intimidating Presence
Effect.Description: Beginning at 10th level, you can use your action to frighten someone with your menacing presence. When you do so, choose one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. If the creature can see or hear you, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier) or be frightened of you until the end of your next turn. On subsequent turns, you can use your action to extend the duration of this effect on the frightened creature until the end of your next turn. This effect ends if the creature ends its turn out of line of sight or more than 60 feet away from you. If the creature succeeds on its saving throw, you can't use this feature on that creature again for 24 hours.
Effect.ShortDescription: Use an action to frighten a creature.

Effect.Name: Retaliation
Effect.Description: Starting at 14th level, when you take damage from a creature that is within 5 feet of you. you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature.
Effect.ShortDescription: Use your reaction to strike back against someone that damaged out.

ClassCustomization.Name: Totem Warrior
ClassCustomization.Description: The Path of the Totem Warrior is a spiritual journey, as the barbarian accepts a spirit animal as guide, protector, and inspiration. In battle, your totem spirit fills you with supernatural might, adding magical fuel to your barbarian rage. Most barbarian tribes consider a totem animal to be kin to a particular clan. In such cases, it is unusual for an individual to have more than one totem animal spirit, though exceptions exist.
ClassCustomization.ShortDescription: Spiritually themed perks enhancing your powers by mimicing animals.

Effect.Name: Spirit Seeker
Effect.Description: Yours is a path that seeks attunement with the natural world, giving you a kinship with beasts. At 3rd level when you adopt this path, you gain the ability to cast the beast sense and speak with animals spells, but only as rituals, as described in chapter 10.
Effect.ShortDescription: Gain ability to cast Beast Sense and Speak with Animals

Effect.Name: Totem Spirit
Effect.Description: At 3rd level, when you adopt this path, you choose a totem spirit and gain its feature. You must make or acquire a physical totem object- an amulet or similar adornment—that incorporates fur or feathers, claws, teeth, or b ones o f the totem animal. At your option, you also gain minor physical attributes that are reminiscent o f your totem spirit. For example, if you have a bear totem spirit, you might be unusually hairy and thickskinned, or if your totem is the eagle, your eyes turn bright yellow. Your totem animal might be an animal related to those listed here but more appropriate to your homeland. For example, you could choose a hawk or vulture in place of an eagle.
Effect.ShortDescription: Gain a benifit of a spirit animal

Choice.Name: Totep Spirit: Bear
Choice.ShortDescription: Gain Resistance to all non-psychic damage while raging.

Effect.Name: Totem Spirit: Bear
Effect.Description: While raging, you have resistance to all damage except psychic damage. The spirit of the bear makes you tough enough to stand up to any punishment.
Effect.ShortDescription: Gain Resistance to all non-psychic damage while raging.

Choice.Name: Totem Spirit: Eagle
Choice.ShortDescription: Gain Dash as a bonus action in rage; enemies have disadvantage on AoO vs. You

Effect.Name: Totem Spirit: Eagle
Effect.Description: While you're raging and aren’t wearing heavy armor, other creatures have disadvantage on opportunity attack rolls against you, and you can use the Dash action as a bonus action on your turn. The spirit of the eagle makes you into a predator w ho can weave through the fray with ease.
Effect.ShortDescription: Gain Dash as a bonus action in rage; enemies have disadvantage on AoO vs. You

Choice.Name: Totem Spirit: Wolf
Choice.ShortDescription: Grant advantage to allies on melee attacks against adjacent enemies.

Effect.Name: Totem Spirit: Wolf
Effect.Description: While you're raging, your friends have advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature within 5 feet of you that is hostile to you. The spirit of the wolf makes you a leader of hunters.
Effect.ShortDescription: Grant advantage to allies on melee attacks against adjacent enemies.

Effect.Name: Aspect of the Beast
Effect.Description: At 6th level, you gain a magical benefit based on the totem animal of your choice. You can choose the same animal you selected at 3rd level or a different one.
Effect.ShortDescription: Gain a benifit of a spirit animal

Effect.Name: Totem Spirit: Bear
Effect.Description: While raging, you have resistance to all damage except psychic damage. The spirit of the bear makes you tough enough to stand up to any punishment.
Effect.ShortDescription: Gain Resistance to all non-psychic damage while raging.

Effect.Name: Totem Spirit: Eagle
Effect.Description: While you're raging and aren’t wearing heavy armor, other creatures have disadvantage on opportunity attack rolls against you, and you can use the Dash action as a bonus action on your turn. The spirit of the eagle makes you into a predator w ho can weave through the fray with ease.
Effect.ShortDescription: Gain Dash as a bonus action in rage; enemies have disadvantage on AoO vs. You

Effect.Name: Totem Spirit: Wolf
Effect.Description: While you're raging, your friends have advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature within 5 feet of you that is hostile to you. The spirit of the wolf makes you a leader of hunters.
Effect.ShortDescription: Grant advantage to allies on melee attacks against adjacent enemies.

Effect.Name: Intimidating Presence
Effect.Description: Beginning at 10th level, you can use your action to frighten someone with your menacing presence. When you do so, choose one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. If the creature can see or hear you, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier) or be frightened of you until the end of your next turn. On subsequent turns, you can use your action to extend the duration of this effect on the frightened creature until the end of your next turn. This effect ends if the creature ends its turn out of line of sight or more than 60 feet away from you. If the creature succeeds on its saving throw, you can't use this feature on that creature again for 24 hours.
Effect.ShortDescription: Use an action to frighten a creature.

Effect.Name: Retaliation
Effect.Description: Starting at 14th level, when you take damage from a creature that is within 5 feet of you. you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature.
Effect.ShortDescription: Use your reaction to strike back against someone that damaged out.

ClassCustomization.Name: Draconic Bloodline
ClassCustomization.Description: Your innate magic comes from draconic magic that was mingled with your blood or that of your ancestors. Most often, sorcerers with this origin trace their descent back to a mighty sorcerer of ancient times who made a bargain with a dragon or who might even have claimed a dragon parent. Some of these bloodlines are well established in the world, but most are obscure. Any given sorcerer could be the first of a new bloodline, as a result of a pact or some other exceptional circumstance.
ClassCustomization.ShortDescription: Draconic magical heritage giving some draconic properties.

Effect.Name: Draconic Resilience
Effect.Description: As magic flows through your body, it causes physical traits of your dragon ancestors to emerge. At 1st level, your hit point maximum increases by 1 and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class. Additionally, parts of your skin are covered by a thin sheen of dragon-like scales. When you aren’t wearing armor, your AC equals 13 + your Dexterity modifier.
Effect.ShortDescription: Gain ability to cast Beast Sense and Speak with Animals
